feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle allows IDOR in RSS block, which allows access to additional RSS feeds
entry.content:
A flaw was found in Moodle. This vulnerability allows unauthorized users to access and view RSS feeds due to insufficient capability checks.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-3636
  • https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-3636
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2359726
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-84499
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/0bd97209ac5e217dbec236c73e4f6fdcaee1c737
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=467598
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-chmf-m33p-ph8m

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle has a CSRF risk in user tours manager that allows tour duplication
entry.content:
A security vulnerability was discovered in Moodle that allows anyone to duplicate existing tours without needing to log in due to a lack of protection against cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-3635
  • https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-3635
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2359709
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/dbd723f81c07423d4082d54cd1d90b1b68c44379
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=467597
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-88xj-97gf-7wpq

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle reveals student identities through assignment submissions search on anonymous submissions
entry.content:
A flaw has was found in Moodle where anonymous assignment submissions can be de-anonymized via search, revealing student identities.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-3628
  • https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-3628
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2359706
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/5c703f7b4944dd0cc940ca20adfd91e6a2d98a66
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=467595
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-69m9-rprc-2x7g

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle makes some user data available before completing second factor with MFA enabled
entry.content:
A security vulnerability was discovered in Moodle that allows some users to access sensitive information about other students before they finish verifying their identities using two-factor authentication (2FA).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-3627
  • https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-3627
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2359692
  • https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Amoodle%2Fmoodle+MDL-84351&type=commits
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=467594
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-x45j-jq9q-gf3q

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle shows hidden grades to users without permission on some grade reports
entry.content:
A flaw has been identified in Moodle where insufficient capability checks in certain grade reports allowed users without the necessary permissions to access hidden grades.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-32045
  • https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-32045
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2356835
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=467086
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-81945
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8m7c-hm88-2p97

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle allows unauthenticated REST API user data exposure
entry.content:
A flaw has been identified in Moodle where, on certain sites, unauthenticated users could retrieve sensitive user data—including names, contact information, and hashed passwords—via stack traces returned by specific API calls. Sites where PHP is configured with zend.exception_ignore_args = 'On' or zend.exception_ignore_args = 1 in the relevant php.ini file are NOT affected by this vulnerability. Sites that do not have the zend.exception_ignore_args setting enabled and are using the internal Moodle LMS authentication system are affected by this vulnerability.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-32044
  • https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-32044
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2356829
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/41917db65e6b3dba3bf3d805a8599e6752655646
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-345q-9jmq-g9q4

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle self enrollment available before completing second factor with MFA enabled
entry.content:
A security vulnerability was discovered in Moodle that allows students to enroll themselves in courses without completing all the necessary safety checks. Specifically, users can sign up for courses prematurely, even if they haven't finished two-step verification processes.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-3634
  • https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-3634
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2359707
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/b0965139014b459c3cb96e4fff45af4d5e09e261
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=467596
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qhc7-xhc2-7p7w
